TopicTitle: Top Gun AI - The Official Tournament Thread

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> On 1/25/2016 at 11:58 AM, Zahida said:
> 
> 
> [![UzQp4KX.png](http://i.imgur.com/UzQp4KX.png)](http://i.imgur.com/UzQp4KX.png "Enlarge image")
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **SHUBADUB**
> 
> 
> 
> 
> After much trial, tribulation, and testing, I present the successor to the CF-59 Naga, the CF-63 Empress. I went through something like over a dozen different aircraft designs before I decided on this one.  Both my aircraft are the same model but one has two 20mm cannons and the other only has one. I took inspiration from the SU-37 and MiG-29 when making this, and I think it turned out pretty well. Please tell me if I need to change anything. Turning on the AI autopilot is done by pressing "0" then spacebar. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Aircraft 1: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/5xzmd8szuhvaayi/Zahida%20-%201%20-%20CF-63%20Empress.craft?dl=0&preview=Zahida+-+1+-+CF-63+Empress.craft](https://www.dropbox.com/s/5xzmd8szuhvaayi/Zahida%20-%201%20-%20CF-63%20Empress.craft?dl=0&preview=Zahida+-+1+-+CF-63+Empress.craft)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Aircraft 2: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/k29r9nobdt9xfg5/Zahida%20-%202%20-%20CF-63%20Empress.craft?dl=0&preview=Zahida+-+2+-+CF-63+Empress.craft](https://www.dropbox.com/s/k29r9nobdt9xfg5/Zahida%20-%202%20-%20CF-63%20Empress.craft?dl=0&preview=Zahida+-+2+-+CF-63+Empress.craft)
> 

Submission inspected and accepted.  I used the offset tool to move the swept wings one increment upward to resolve the clipping as depicted [here](http://imgur.com/zr9KRZb).  I can't tell you how good it is to see a submission from a fresh player, especially a good one!  I pray it does well, and that you'll stick around for more tournaments in the future.  Best wishes!  

>

If we get enough submissions that doing this isn't necessary, then I will replace your second plane with this one.

You're welcome to if you like.  

I personally believe you'd have an easier time editing the relatively minor clipping out of the Empress while retaining aesthetic integrity than starting again from scratch.  Maybe putting a second pair of swept wings underneath the first one, offset a degree down relative to the way the original pair were attached, would make it look more appealing?  You are free to do design a new plane if you would prefer, just as long as your submission comes in before February 1st.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-01-27T22:27:05Z" title="01/27/2016 10:27  PM" data-short="8 yr">January 27, 2016</time> by PTGFlyer**

Umm....as anybody updated BDArmory to version 0.10 yet? If any of us has, we are going to have to rethink our planes and strategies.   

The AI is WAY different, enough that the plane's flight characteristics may or may not help us.  

Off-the-cuff changes I've noticed:  

-Physics has been extended to 5000 metres  

-gun range that the AI uses to determine whether or not to fire has a adjustment. Can go from nil to around 8000 metres.  

-There is a minimum engagement speed, an idle speed, a maximum speed  

-The Missiles (not pertinent to our tournament) has fire rate adjustments (would help with suicides by slapping into the missiles)  

Maybe we should get updated, let CreativeCombat have a look and let us all agree on parameters for the tournament.  

@CreativeCombat: I'm pulling out my planes until I can get a chance to really examine the new AI system. Sorry.

> 8 hours ago, PTGFlyer said:
> 
> 
> That just makes it more challenging and fun. I think B9 and FAR should be allowed.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Where do you put up designs? I see other people's for download, but how do I do that?
> 

Stock and BDArmory only, no B9.  Designing a fighter in FAR for a competition that's being held with stock aerodynamics would not be a good idea, though I can't stop you from doing so.  Submit designs by whatever means necessary, Dropbox, Media fire, KerbalX, whatever works.  I prefer dropbox or media fire.  

**Read the rules on page 51 very, very carefully before you make your submission.**  

**It also will have to be submitted BEFORE FEBRUARY 1ST ACCORDING TO PACIFIC STANDARD TIME, or it won't fly in this tournament.** 

**If you'd like tips and tricks on how to build a good plane, I'd highly recommend watching [the last tournament](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DDCUoGi9h1g&list=PLC03uDNY3jIECmnVwCm7cZGKkl6l1eflQ) that was run.**
I saw the MediaFire and DropBox thing, what I meant was how do I do that so you can get it?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, PTGFlyer said:
> 
> 
> I saw the MediaFire and DropBox thing, what I meant was how do I do that so you can get it?
> 

Similar to how you would install a mod.  First, create the craft.  Then go to your KSP\_Win folder, the same way you got to GameData when you were installing BDArmory, and go to Saves.  Then go to the save you created the ship in, open the "Ships" folder, open the "SPH" folder, select the craft file of the ship you created, copy it, publicize it through any of the file sharing methods described above.  Then post the link in the thread as per "Tournament Submission Guidelines" on page 51.  Do make sure you've included a picture with your post.  You can do that by pressing F1 while looking at the ship in the spaceplane hangar, then find that image by going to KSP\_Win and going to "Screenshots".  Upload it to Imgur and post the link to the Imgur upload along with your craft file in the thread.  Also be sure to follow the naming conventions outlined on Page 51.  

Thank you for your interest.  Good luck.
